result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaurissa E Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 08/24/15 or civil judgment.

08-25-15/ Lindsey  Grady
Defendant failed to report on 06-30-15 as ordered.
Court authorizes commitment and defendant will be denied any and all Huber privileges
Huber for work and treatment. Court grants release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY if defendant cooperates and provides the name of the co-actor to police. Court stays report date to 06/30/15 by 5pm.
Restitution not ordered at this time, but if restitution is determined at a later date, it is to be joint and several.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence and upon cooperation with police and providing the name of the co-actor in this case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaurissa E Peters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 08-25-15 Court order denying any and all Huber privileges

Defendant Kaurissa E Peters not in court. Defendant did not report to serve her sentence at the House of Corrections on 06/30/2015 as ordered.  
For reasons stated on the record, Court authorized the commitment of the defendant.
Court ordered that due to the failure to report, the defendant will be denied any and all Huber privileges.

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge  Grady  Br  23 for review. os
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence and upon cooperation with police and providing the name of the co-actor in this case.

Defendant Kaurissa E Peters in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Filed, Victim Impact Statement. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 5 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  Court grants release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY IF defendant cooperates and provides the name of the co-actor to police.  Court stays report date to 06-30-2015 by 5pm.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges by 08-24-2015 or civil judgment.  
Restitution not ordered at this time, but if restitution is determined at a later date, it is to be joint and several. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence and upon cooperation with police and providing the name of the co-actor in this case. 

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Kaurissa E Peters in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over and offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kaurissa E Peters in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
